meanings.sent1: Walking on the precarious bridge made me nervous.
meanings.sent2: The old ladder felt precarious as I climbed it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to balance a spoon on my nose was a precarious task.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was as precarious as a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The fragile glass sculpture stood in a precarious position on the shelf.

meanings.sent1: The stack of books on the wobbly table looked precarious.
meanings.sent2: The makeshift shelter was precarious in the storm.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at juggling oranges was a precarious display of skill.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two countries was as precarious as a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: The loose rock on the cliff made the climb feel even more precarious.

meanings.sent1: Venturing into the dark cave seemed precarious.
meanings.sent2: The icy road conditions made driving feel precarious.
meanings.sent3: Balancing a stack of plates on one hand was a precarious move.
meanings.sent4: His decision to invest all his money in one stock was as precarious as walking a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat's performance on the high wire was a precarious display of skill.
